properties.areaDesc: Warren, TN; De Kalb, TN; Rutherford, TN; Wilson, TN; Cannon, TN; Smith, TN
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 5 at 8:01PM CST until February 5 at 9:30PM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southwestern Smith County in Middle Tennessee...
Western De Kalb County in Middle Tennessee...
Rutherford County in Middle Tennessee...
Northwestern Warren County in Middle Tennessee...
Wilson County in Middle Tennessee...
Cannon County in Middle Tennessee...

* Until 930 PM CST.

* At 758 PM CST, rain and thunderstorms were decreasing. However,
significant rainfall had caused some flash flooding, and flooding
is still ongoing.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Murfreesboro, Lebanon, McMinnville, Woodbury, Smyrna, Watertown,
Walterhill, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Auburntown,
Centertown, Lascassas, Tuckers Crossroads, Cedars Of Lebanon State
Park, Rockvale, Bradyville, Milton, Gladeville and Readyville.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 9:30 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
